publicwhip.spmotion: * S2M-2425# Pauline McNeill:Franz Ferdinand Rocks—That the Parliament congratulates Franz Ferdinand on winning the Best British Band and Best Rock Act awards at the 25th Brit Awards; welcomes the First Minister’s view that Scotland should be a future host to the Brit Awards; notes that Scotland has an abundance of talented musicians, demonstrated by the fact that 11 acts are to appear at the international music festival in Texas, South by Southwest; believes that Scotland has a strong contemporary music industry which makes a significant contribution to the Scottish economy, comprising of small, medium and large companies; supports the work of the Cross Party Group on the Scottish Contemporary Music Industry which brings together virtually all strands of the music industry; recognises the commitment of the Scottish Executive to the industry and the funding of research into the feasibility of creating a music industry forum; further recognises initiatives such as Music Works, funded by Scottish Enterprise, and the need for the enterprise agencies to promote a distinct music industry strategy so as to encourage further development of Scottish-based musicians and related business activity, and sends its good wishes to all bands who are participating in South by Southwest. Supported by: John Home Robertson*, Richard Baker*, Bristow Muldoon*, Patrick Harvie*, Mike Watson*, Mr Alasdair Morrison*, Sarah Boyack*, Christine May*, Alex Neil*, Trish Godman*

S2M-2425# Franz Ferdinand Rocks (lodged on 11 February 2005) Rosie Kane*, Margaret Smith*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Fiona Hyslop*, Margaret Jamieson*, Nora Radcliffe*, Scott Barrie*, Jackie Baillie*, Colin Fox*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Chris Ballance*, Marlyn Glen*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Cathie Craigie*, Cathy Peattie*
S2M-2425# Franz Ferdinand Rocks (lodged on 11 February 2005) Ms Rosemary Byrne*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*
S2M-2425# Franz Ferdinand Rocks (lodged on 11 February 2005) Eleanor Scott*, Mrs Mary Mulligan*
S2M-2425# Franz Ferdinand Rocks (lodged on 11 February 2005) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2425# Franz Ferdinand Rocks (lodged on 11 February 2005) Linda Fabiani*

S2M-2425 # Pauline McNeill:Franz Ferdinand Rocks—That the Parliament congratulates Franz Ferdinand on winning the Best British Band and Best Rock Act awards at the 25th Brit Awards; welcomes the First Minister’s view that Scotland should be a future host to the Brit Awards; notes that Scotland has an abundance of talented musicians, demonstrated by the fact that 11 acts are to appear at the international music festival in Texas, South by Southwest; believes that Scotland has a strong contemporary music industry which makes a significant contribution to the Scottish economy, comprising of small, medium and large companies; supports the work of the Cross Party Group on the Scottish Contemporary Music Industry which brings together virtually all strands of the music industry; recognises the commitment of the Scottish Executive to the industry and the funding of research into the feasibility of creating a music industry forum; further recognises initiatives such as Music Works, funded by Scottish Enterprise, and the need for the enterprise agencies to promote a distinct music industry strategy so as to encourage further development of Scottish-based musicians and related business activity, and sends its good wishes to all bands who are participating in South by Southwest. Supported by: John Home Robertson, Richard Baker, Bristow Muldoon, Patrick Harvie, Mike Watson, Mr Alasdair Morrison, Sarah Boyack, Christine May, Alex Neil, Trish Godman, Rosie Kane, Margaret Smith, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Frank McAveety, Fiona Hyslop, Margaret Jamieson, Nora Radcliffe, Scott Barrie, Jackie Baillie, Colin Fox, Dr Elaine Murray, Chris Ballance, Marlyn Glen, Mr Jamie Stone, Cathie Craigie, Cathy Peattie, Ms Rosemary Byrne, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Eleanor Scott, Mrs Mary Mulligan, Donald Gorrie, Linda Fabiani, Irene Oldfather, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Duncan McNeil*
S2M-2425# Franz Ferdinand Rocks (lodged on 11 February 2005) Mark Ballard*, Bruce Crawford*, Margo MacDonald*, Bill Aitken* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
S2M-2425# Franz Ferdinand Rocks (lodged on 11 February 2005) Mr Adam Ingram*, Rob Gibson*, Michael Matheson* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J
